title: Mechanical and Machinery hazards | Contact With Moving Parts of Equipment

tasks.task: Address the risks of contact with moving parts on construction sites by ensuring proper equipment and training.
subtasks: Understand the hazards of moving parts (hurts, serious injury, 20 deaths per year, 300 amputations).
Identify construction equipment with moving parts (machinery, powered equipment) that require guarding.
Ensure 100% inaccessibility to moving parts on certain machinery via guards or safety devices.
For other machinery where access can't be prevented during operation, install guards and safety devices to control access.
Regularly inspect safety devices; stop using equipment if defects are found and make necessary repairs.
Do not remove, block, or tamper with safety devices or guards.
When maintaining machinery (e.g., blade replacement), ensure power is disconnected (unplug, remove battery), and follow lockout procedures.
Properly train and inform workers about preventive measures and safety rules to avoid accidents.
Plan jobs with safety at the forefront to complete tasks safely.

tasks.task: Operate construction machinery with moving parts safely.
subtasks: Operate machinery with moving parts safely by adhering to safety devices and training.

tasks.task: Inspect machinery and equipment regularly for safety device compliance.
subtasks: Check all safety devices on construction equipment are in place, undamaged, and working properly.
Immediately address or report any defects or malfunctions in safety devices.

tasks.task: Use personal protective equipment (PPE) while operating machinery.
subtasks: Wear appropriate PPE, such as hard hats, safety glasses, gloves, steel-toed boots, to protect against moving part injuries.

tasks.task: Follow machine operation procedures to prevent contact with moving parts.
subtasks: Never position body parts near moving parts during operation.
Use assistive tools or devices instead of body parts to interact with moving parts when necessary.

tasks.task: Conduct regular safety drills and updates with workers on moving part safety.
subtasks: Participate in safety meetings to review moving part hazards and preventive measures.
Simulate emergencies and respsonse procedures in case of moving part injuries.
